intro: Echium × taibiquense, commonly known as the hybrid blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces slender, branching stems and has hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Echium × taibiquense is often found in open areas with full sun exposure, making it a notable species in its native ecosystem.
